intro: Basanacantha spinosa var. longipedunculata, commonly known as the long-peduncled spiny hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or yellow. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a velvety texture. This variant is distinguished by its elongated peduncles, which support its clusters of flowers.
